title: 112_s1476
content: The Act titled "Federal Workforce Reduction and Reform Act of 2011" includes a freeze on pay and bonuses for federal employees. The Federal Workforce Reduction and Reform Act of 2011 extends the pay freeze for federal employees to three years, until December 31, 2014. Additionally, there is a three-year freeze on bonuses for fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014. The agency can pay bonuses or cash awards to employees, including recruitment, retention, and performance-based cash awards under specific laws. SEC. 3. REDUCTION IN FEDERAL WORKFORCE. In this section, definitions for "agency," "Federal employee," and "total number of Federal employees" are provided. The President must ensure that the total number of Federal employees does not exceed 85 percent of the total number in 2011 starting from fiscal year 2022. The Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with the Office of Personnel Management, is responsible for monitoring and notification. The Budget, in consultation with the Office of Personnel Management, must monitor agencies to determine if the total number of Federal employees exceeds the maximum allowed. If so, written notice must be provided to the President and Congress within 14 days. The Office of Management and Budget is responsible for compliance and notification regarding the total number of Federal employees. The Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with the Office of Personnel Management, monitors Federal agencies to ensure they do not exceed the maximum number of employees allowed. If the limit is exceeded, written notice must be given to the President and Congress within 14 days. The President can waive this requirement in cases of war, national security concerns, or emergencies. The President, through the Office of Management and Budget, must ensure that there is no increase in service contracts procurement unless it is financially advantageous. Any necessary regulations can be prescribed by the President or his designee. SEC. 4. REDUCTION IN CONTRACT EMPLOYEES. The term "agency" in this section refers to Executive agencies, excluding the Government Accountability Office. The President, through the Office of Management and Budget, must ensure that the total number of contract employees does not exceed 85 percent of the total number as of September 30, 2011, starting in fiscal year 2022. The Office of Management and Budget will monitor agencies to determine if the limit is being exceeded. The Office of Management and Budget must monitor if the total number of contract employees exceeds the maximum allowable limit. If the limit is exceeded, written notice must be provided to the President and Congress within 14 days. After such notice, no agency can appoint new employees to fill vacancies until the limit is met. The Office of Management and Budget must monitor the total number of contract employees and provide written notice to the President and Congress if the limit is exceeded. No new employees can be appointed to fill vacancies until the limit is met. The section can be waived in cases of war, national security concerns, or emergencies. The number of contract employees should be expressed on a full-time equivalent basis. The number of contract employees must be expressed on a full-time equivalent basis. Regulations for this section can be prescribed by the President or his designee. SEC. 5. LIMITATION OF GOVERNMENT TRAVEL COSTS. In this section, the term "agency" is defined and excludes the Department of Defense. The total amount paid or reimbursed by an agency for travel expenses is limited to 50% for fiscal years 2012 and 2013, and 25% for fiscal year 2014 compared to the amount paid in fiscal year 2011. In fiscal year 2011, exceptions are made for certain expenses related to law enforcement personnel and national security. Regulations for this subsection will be prescribed by the same authorities responsible for regulations under section 5707 of title 5, United States Code. For fiscal years 2012 through 2014, each agency must set aside a reserve travel amount equal to 10 percent of their total appropriations for travel expenses. This amount is to be available for expenditure or obligation by September 1 of each fiscal year for reimbursement under travel and subsistence expense regulations. The curr_chunk states regulations regarding travel and subsistence expenses for Federal employees.
